body: Same here on Vagrant 1.9.4, Windows 10 Home x64 and VirtualBox 5.1.20 with box ubuntu/xenial64 (v20170424.0.0).

I had the same error here (Vagrant 1.9.4, Windows 7 x64, VB 5.1.20 with box ubuntu/xenial64). It looks like an exception `Errno::ECONNABORTED` is raised if the guest is booting when vagrant tries to connect through ssh. 

As a workaround, I added `Errno::ECONNABORTED` in the array `exceptions` at line 356 of the file `communicators/ssh/communicator.rb` as well as a corresponding `rescue` at line 407.
Same error for me. I've downgraded to 1.9.3. Works OK.
Same thing for me for both Vagrant 1.9.3 and 1.9.4, Win 7 and VirtualBox 5.1.20
Is any fix coming? I am stuck and can't launch any VM since tow days ðŸ˜ž
@bbkane I was able to provision my machine a couple of time, but I am unaware of side effects.

issue.title: Retry SSH connection on Errno::ECONNABORTED

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
In some cases the SSH connection may be aborted while waiting
for setup. This includes aborted connections in the list of
applicable exceptions to retry on while waiting for the connection
to become available.

Fixes #8520

body: @chrisroberts Thanks for fixing the issue! I noticed you put it on the 1.9.5 milestone. Pardon my ignorance, but how soon will this change be reflected on the [Downloads page](https://www.vagrantup.com/downloads.html)?

Update:
Please upgrade vagrant to 1.9.5 as it's released. The version contains fix for this issue.

Following is no longer needed:
Those who want to fix it now in your computer without waiting for 1.9.5 can replace 3 files changed in https://github.com/mitchellh/vagrant/issues/8526 in vagrant installation directory.

For example in windows, those files are located in 
* ```C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/gems/vagrant-1.9.4/templates/locales/en.yml```
* ```C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/gems/vagrant-1.9.4/lib/vagrant/errors.rb```
* ```C:/HashiCorp/Vagrant/embedded/gems/gems/vagrant-1.9.4/plugins/communicators/ssh/communicator.rb```

replace them with new [en.yml](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chrisroberts/vagrant/2acded113c8f8915038b6230df1acfac43332c0c/templates/locales/en.yml), [errors.rb](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chrisroberts/vagrant/2acded113c8f8915038b6230df1acfac43332c0c/lib/vagrant/errors.rb) and [communicator.rb](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chrisroberts/vagrant/2acded113c8f8915038b6230df1acfac43332c0c/plugins/communicators/ssh/communicator.rb)

Then you are good to go. It worked on my Windows 10 machine. One gotcha is in Windows, you have to change folder permission of the directory to edit or create new files.

issue.title: `readpartial` error when doing vagrant up

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
### Vagrant version
`Vagrant 1.9.4`

### Host operating system
Windows 8.1 x64

### Guest operating system
Ubuntu/Xenial64

### Vagrantfile
```ruby

Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
  config.vm.box = "ubuntu/xenial64"

  config.vm.network "private_network", ip: "192.168.33.22"

  config.vm.synced_folder ".", "/vagrant"

  config.vm.provider "virtualbox" do |vb|
 	vb.name = "bbb"
	vb.memory = "4096"
	vb.cpus = 1
  end
end

```

### Debug output
https://pastebin.com/4ueUJyHf

### Expected behavior
VM should run without any error.

### Actual behavior
The error displays.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Update files in PR https://github.com/mitchellh/vagrant/issues/8520
2. Run `vagrant up`

body: sorry i have windows 8 i can't fix this problem....can you help me?
